name: Ernesto Brambilla
introduction: Ernesto 'Tino' Brambilla (born 31 January 1934) is a former Grand Prix motorcycle road racer and a professional race driver from Italy. Born in Monza, he was the older brother of driver Vittorio Brambilla. Brambilla entered in two Formula One Grand Prix races, firstly in the 1963 Italian Grand Prix with Scuderia Centro Sud, driving a Cooper, which he failed to qualify. For the 1969 race, he was entered by Ferrari, but the car was ultimately driven by Pedro Rodrguez.
